Package pizzafactory.classes

Class Order

java.lang.Object
pizzafactory.classes.Order
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<Order>
public class Order extends Object implements Comparable<Order>
The order class represents a customer's order, which can then be cooked and served.
Since:
2024-03-04
Version:
0.3
Author:
Samuel Stanton

  • Constructor Details

    • Order

      public Order(int orderId, int customerNumber, Pizza orderPizza, int pizzaQuantity)
      Constructs a new order with a number, customer number, pizza to be ordered and quantity.
      Parameters:
      orderId - The ID of the order. Should be auto-incremented when the order is created.
      customerNumber - The ID of the customer who created the order.
      orderPizza - The pizza to be ordered.
      pizzaQuantity - The amount of pizzas that need to be cooked.

  • Method Details

    • getOrderId

      public int getOrderId()
      Returns the numerical ID of the order.
      Returns:
      An integer representing the order's ID. A greater ID should indicate a more recent order.

    • getOrderCookTime

      public int getOrderCookTime()
      Returns the total cook time of the order.
      Returns:
      An integer representing the order's total cook time in seconds.

    • getCustomerNumber

      public int getCustomerNumber()
      Returns the number of the customer who placed the order.
      Returns:
      An integer representing the customer's ID number.

    • cookOrder

      public void cookOrder()
      Set the order's status to cooked.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Collects all information about the order and outputs it in a human-readable format.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      A string representing all variables of the order.

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo(Order order2)
      Compares two orders (order1, order2) based on their order IDs.
      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface Comparable<Order>
      Parameters:
      order2 - The order to compare this order to.
      Returns:
      An integer based on which order is higher. If order1 is higher, a value greater than zero will be returned. If order2 is higher, a value less than zero will be returned.
